caption:
TABLE 2 
Comparison with state-of-the-art methods on A2D Sentences for referring video segmentation. Our method 
significantly outperforms state-of-the-arts using only RGB input.

TABLE 3 
Comparison with state-of-the-art methods on JHMDB Sentences for referring video segmentation. Our method 
significantly outperforms previous ones using only RGB input.

TABLE 4 
Comparison with state-of-the-art methods on Refer-Youtube-VOS dataset. Our method outpreforms previous 
ones without memory attention across frames.

TABLE 5 
Ablation studies of CMPC-I and TGFE modules on UNC val set. EP and RAR indicate entity perception and 
relation-aware reasoning stages. CMF denotes concatenating multimodal feature from EP instead of pure visual 
feature for the output of CMPC-I. Here TGFE adopts one round of feature exchange.

Table 7. AR and DR 
represent "Adaptive Relevance" in RAR and "Direct 
Relevance" in original AAR respectively. Adaptive 
relevance yields inferior performance than direct rele-
vance, indicating that direct relevance is more suitable 
to propagate information among different frames.

TABLE 8 
Overall IoUs of different numbers of feature exchange 
rounds in TGFE module on UNC val set. n denotes 
the number of feature exchange rounds. Remove the 
engineering technique CMF from CMPC-I module.

TABLE 9 
Ablation studies of necessary words extracting (NW) 
on UNC val set.

TABLE 10 
Experiments of graph convolution on UNC val set and 
G-Ref val set in terms of overall IoU. g denotes the 
number of graph convolution layers. Experiments are 
all conducted on single level feature w/o CMF.
mergedAllColumns: obtains better performance than 1 layer while 3 layers

associatedMergedColumns: obtains better performance than 1 layer while 3 layers
